title: 2d-3d Template construction on custom dataset
body:
**Task** (what are you trying to do/register?)

I'm trying to create a template on a custom dataset of 3d brain mri scan

**What have you tried**

I have modified the tutorial code for 2d template creation and and set the src_feats to the dimension of my scans. The dimension of my scans is 192,192,256, as per the tutorial the vol_shape comes out to be (192,192). In the tutorial it was similar, however the last dimension for the images was 1. When I sent these images to the model it gave an input dimension error  "expected 192,192,1 got 192,192,256". I tried changing src_feats to 256, this seemed to fix the input dimension issue but I get a very blurry template from this. 

**Details of experiments**
As in the tutorial, adam loss is being used.
At the time of writing this issue I cannot provide inputs and outputs since they were discarded and I am unable to re run it due to some tensorflow issues. A detailed approach on template creation for 3d data would be really helpful. I have attached my code for reference.
[vxm3DTemp.zip](https://github.com/voxelmorph/voxelmorph/files/9543361/vxm3DTemp.zip)
